ygData.messageBody:
You have to understand that a magic attack that did 800 damage would
be insanely powerful. Ok, lets just say that paladins and
shadowknights are evenly matched fighting hth, you both injure each
other down to 1/2 hp. Probably not enough to warrant the paladins
Lay Hands.... but then you harm touch him finishing off his remaining
hps, dropping him dead to the ground. THAT is the benefit of our
ability. Now, our spells may not be the greatest at first, but later
on they start becoming MUCH better. For example our DoT spells, and
lifedrain spells can be VERY helpful. Our pets aren't meant to kill
the enemy, but be more of a DoT thing, they stand there inflicting
extra damage on the enemy as you fight them as well. Things in EQ
are actually quite well balanced, and I commend verant on a job well
done.


>From: "Howard Chan" <hchan@...>
>Reply-To: eq_shadowknights@onelist.com
>To: <eq_shadowknights@onelist.com>
>Subject: [eq_shadowknights] IMBALANCES: READ - Some insights
>Date: Fri, 23 Apr 1999 19:11:42 -0600
>
>From: "Howard Chan" <hchan@...>
>
>I have played through many classes and have found the SK to be
relatively
>weak in comparison to every other class. First of all, it is the HT.
Some
>argued that it would completely imbalance the game if it does not
have a
>saving throw; this is NOT TRUE. Think of it this way:
>
>Paladin (level 20) - 500HP
>Shadow Knight (level 20) - 500HP
>
>Now, the Shadow Knight's HT does 201 damage - not even half of the
Paladin's
>life. This is a once a day ability that can either be resisted or
partially
>resisted. On the other hand, the Paladin can Lay Hands anytime to
recover
>all 500HP. Perhaps I'm missing something or there is some form of
>mathematical derivation to this, but from what I see, 201 /= 500.
>
>Then one would argue that we have pets, but I can also say that the
Paladins
>get buffs and heals. What are Shadow Knights reduced to? A 5 point
damage
>Diease Cloud and a strength stealing spell that has no noticable
effect
>(other than allowing one to carry 10 more weigh units?). We have to
sit for
>over 20 minutes after each fight to recover. On level 15, our spell
is still
>inferior to the Paladins. What other hybrids have to sit so long?
Paladins
>and Rangers can heal themselves right up. In addition, we get KOS
and have
>less places to travel to to get experience. Although, it is stated
that
>playing a SK would be of high difficulty, but as mentioned above, we
should
>get invisibility at some point.
>
>In conclusion, we are simply a warrior with a experience penalty.
Sure, we
>got HT and all the pets in the world. But does that add up to the
kicks,
>dual wield and double attack damage (oh, don't forget that
berserker's rage)
>that the warrior does? The answer is obvious - NO. If we get the
Lifetap
>series and a 100% functioning HT, then this class might be
comparible to the
>other classes. Until then, I will stick with my SK class just
because I look
>cool as a warrior (with a experience penalty) with a pet.
>
